intro: Gypsophila raphiophylla, commonly known as the desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms during the summer months. Gypsophila raphiophylla is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
